title: TintoNegro 2014 Limestone Block Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Smoky, spicy aromas are highly wood-driven, which creates hickory and campfire scents rather than discernible fruit. This feels a touch sticky and soupy, while baked, woody berry, black plum and cassis flavors are charred prior to a spicy, chunky finish.

title: Troon 2014 Longue Carabine White (Applegate Valley)
description: This unusual blend, all co-fermented, includes roughly equal proportions of Vermentino, Viognier and Marsanne, with a splash of Roussanne. It's perfumed with the intensity of Gewürztraminer, a mix of baby powder and candied citrus, and those flavors carry through the palate. Though listed as just 12.5% abv, it tastes and feels much riper, showing some heat in the aftertaste.

title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Bruto Avesso (Vinho Verde)
description: A fresh lemon-flavored wine with crisp acidity balanced by warmer white-stone fruit. It is fruity, showing a touch of toast and almonds. Drink now.

title: Boffa 2013 Pajè  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of leather, vineyard dust, dried violet and a whiff of pressed powder lead the nose. The simple palate isn't very expressive, showing sour red cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside close-grained tannins that dry out the finish.

title: Brennan 2014 Super Nero Nero d'Avola (Texas)
description: An enticing mix of dark berries and fatty, cured sausage makes for an interesting nose. There's good structure and balance on the palate with this southern Italian transplant. It's juicy, ripe and ready for barbecue.

title: Brennan 2015 Reddy Vineyard Roussanne (Texas High Plains)
description: Peach, canned tropical fruit and white flower aromas are pristine on the nose. The medium-bodied palate shows a balance of juicy peach and pineapple, with streaks of chalk and a vein of acidity. This is clean, succinct and perfectly enjoyable on its own.

title: Château Vitallis 2015  Mâcon-Fuissé
description: This wine is crisp, full of red apple and green-plum flavors, with a touch of minerality in the tangy texture. From chalky soil, it is tight and bright with lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Collina Serragrilli 2013 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, coffee, underbrush and a hint of fig. The full-bodied palate shows oak, espresso, hazelnut, dark pepper and clove but not much fruit. Assertive tannins grip the finish.

title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)
description: With Verdelho and Viognier in the blend, this attractive wine has a ripe perfumed character. It also has a crisp side with its lemon fruits that contrast with the spicy pear and melon. It is ready to drink, bright and crisp at the end.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Cola and cranberry juice decorate the crushed asphalt and light peppercorn notes of the nose on this bottling by Adam Lazarre and company. The palate plays the slightly underripe card, with Kalamata olive and green-peppercorn notes spicing up the more standard cranberry and pomegranate flavors. It's quite vibrant and zesty.

title: DanCin 2014 Trata Pinot Noir (Southern Oregon)
description: Sharp, chewy and aggressively tannic, this simply refuses to emerge from its tannic shell. The stiffly herbal flavors dominate, while any ripe fruit seems to be in hiding at the moment, despite lengthy aeration.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Gaia White (Tupungato)
description: Aromas of almond and apple don't show much sizzle or snap. This blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc is round and soft in feel, with slightly cidery flavors of apricot and apple. Drink now.

title: Cascina Bruciata 2013  Barbaresco
description: The nose isn't very expressive, offering aromas of toasted hazelnut, while the dense, simple palate shows dried black cherry and licorice. It's shy on freshness and has round but rather fleeting tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Castello di Neive 2013  Barbaresco
description: This opens with aromas of toast, oak, menthol, resin, coffee bean and medicinal notes. The aromas carry over to the firm palate, along with thyme, clove, licorice and bracing tannins.

title: Antucura 2011 Grand Vin Red (Vista Flores)
description: Flat in color, with a dull luster, this smells mulchy and earthy, with dampness to the nose. A thick, medicinal palate is dealing severe tannins embedded into a syrupy texture. Flavors of fig, raisin and earth are a little spent.

title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
description: Perfumed and crisp, this is attractive and medium-sweet. It has fine acidity to balance the sweetness and a line of clean acidity that goes with the preserved lemon and tangy aftertaste.

title: Becker 2014 Reserve Bingham Vineyard Roussanne (Texas High Plains)
description: White lily, popcorn kernel, citrus spray and underripe peach lead the well-integrated and restrained nose. The palate follows suit, remaining quiet and delicate in flavor concentration, yet loud in weight and texture. Salty citrus lingers on the finish.

title: Bex 2014 Riesling (Nahe)
description: Whiffs of smoke and nuts mingle into tart tangerine and lime flavors in this refreshing off-dry Riesling. Juicy and fresh, it's a straightforward, revitalizing sip. Drink now through 2018.

title: Evans & Tate 2015 Breathing Space Sauvignon Blanc (Australia)
description: Green beans and snap peas give this Sauvignon Blanc a green cast overall, but there's some citrus and gooseberry fruit as well. It's clean and refreshing on the finish.

title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)
description: Aromas of citrus and petrol are backed by a juicy palate with tangy acidity and semisharp flavors of peach, tangerine and stone-fruit pits. Fresh, citrusy length and a lingering note of orange are the finish.

title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)
description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.

title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)
description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.

title: Louis Max 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: Tight and structured, this wine has minerality as well as tangy lemon character. It has a crisp side, with citrus fruits and attractive acidity. The aftertaste is bright with freshness.

title: Lovingston 2014 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)
description: Medium ruby along the rim, with purple in the core, this Merlot starts off with ripe red cherry and plum on the nose, with fern and warm spice adding nuance. The palate is soft and plush, with grippy black-tea tannins supporting juicy red-fruit flavors.

title: Luigi Bosca 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of tomato leaf, brick dust and herbal red plum set up a wide, scratchy, drying palate. Flavors of herbal plum and raspberry come with minty notes, while the finish is solid on the surface but hollow in the middle.

title: M2 2014 Lodi Native Soucie Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: This untamed, boisterous wine has aromas like herbs and cola leading to powerful grapy, berrylike flavors and an assertive, grainy texture.

title: Manos Negras 2015 Atrevida Malbec (Agrelo)
description: Floral aromas, berry scents, wet cement and saucy notes drive the nose on this viscous, almost sticky Malbec. Baked berry flavors don't show much follow through on the finish, which offers more minty oak than fruit.

title: Monti 2012  Barolo
description: You'll find aromas suggesting weedy underbrush, porcini mushroom, raw oak and dried sage on this bracing wine. The medium-bodied palate shows toast, unripe cherry and star anise alongside extremely astringent tannins.

title: Jean Curial 2014  Saint-Véran
description: This tight wine has acidity with a crisp texture and hints of the fruit to come. A potential for richness comes from the ripe yellow fruits that are developing. Drink from 2017.

title: Jean-Marie Chaland 2014 En Thurissey  (Viré-Clessé)
description: This wine offers an attractive mix of mango and kiwi fruit, with a light structure. A fresh, fruity tang makes it full while also refreshing. Drink now.
